entry.title: US, Russia reaffirm commitment to Armenia-Azerbaijan peace talks

media:group.media:title: US, Russia reaffirm commitment to Armenia-Azerbaijan peace talks
media:group.media:description:
üìçA military court in Azerbaijan sentenced Vagif Khachatryan, an Armenian man from Nagorno-Karabakh, to 15 years in prison on charges of genocide and forcible population transfer. Khachatryan has repeatedly denied the charges. üìçArmenia has purchased $41.5 million worth of anti-drone systems from India, according to that country‚Äôs Eurasian Times newspaper. CivilNet has not been able to independently verify the news. üìçThe United States and Russia each reaffirmed their commitment to facilitating talks to allow Armenia and Azerbaijan to reach a peace deal.
Credits: Ruptly

entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs top general holds talks with US military

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs top general holds talks with US military
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmen Grigoryan, Armenia‚Äôs security chief, declined to attend an upcoming meeting with his counterparts from other former Soviet countries in Russia. üìçArmenia‚Äôs top army officials held talks on defense cooperation with senior officials at the United States‚Äô military headquarters in Europe. üìçLevon Kocharyan, the son of ex-President Robert Kocharyan, was released from detention after agreeing to take up a seat in Armenia‚Äôs parliament. üìçArmenia submitted a bid to host the 2027 Francophone games.

entry.title: Advocating for Armenian POWs in Azerbaijan

media:group.media:title: Advocating for Armenian POWs in Azerbaijan
media:group.media:description:
Lori Yeni-Komshian is an attorney who relocated from San Francisco to Armenia about a year ago to participate in human rights initiatives, including with the Center for Truth and Justice and the International and Comparative Law Center. Lori advocates for the release of Armenian prisoners of war and civilians in Azerbaijan, and is involved in comprehensive fact-finding investigations into reported atrocities. In this interview, Lori speaks to CivilNet about her work, the challenges she faces, and the significance of keeping a record of human rights violations and war crimes.

entry.title: Standoff in Jerusalem‚Äôs Armenian Quarter over land deal ends without incident

media:group.media:title: Standoff in Jerusalem‚Äôs Armenian Quarter over land deal ends without incident
media:group.media:description:
üìçGermany‚Äôs foreign minister urged Armenia and Azerbaijan to resume peace talks mediated by the European Union during a first-of-its-kind visit to the region. üìçA standoff between members of Jerusalem‚Äôs Armenian community and representatives of an Israeli company involved in a controversial land deal ended without incident. üìçLevon Kocharyan, the son of former President Robert Kocharyan, is set to join Armenia‚Äôs National Assembly as a lawmaker. As of Monday, he was being held in pretrial detention.

entry.title: Grappling with loss, rebuilding a life after the fall of Karabakh

media:group.media:title: Grappling with loss, rebuilding a life after the fall of Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
Aida Avagyan and her four children were evacuated from the village of Aghavno in Nagorno-Karabakh last August, just days before it was handed over to Azerbaijan as part of a Russia-brokered ceasefire declaration.
She relocated her family to the town of Goris in southern Armenia, where she opened a small guesthouse and began hosting people evacuated from Nagorno-Karabakh by the International Committee of the Red Cross during Azerbaijan‚Äôs blockade of the region.
Following Azerbaijan‚Äôs lightning offensive against Nagorno-Karabakh this September, Avagyan scrambled to host other people forcibly displaced from their homes.
She sat down with CivilNet to share her story of displacement and her hopes for the future.
